verses.verse: God’s Wonders at the Exodus (Ex 13.3) (Psalms 114-115 are a single psalm in the earliest witnesses) When Israel went out from Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language,
(Ex 19.6) Judah became God’s (Heb his) sanctuary, Israel his dominion.
(Ex 14.21; Josh 3.13, 16) The sea looked and fled; Jordan turned back.
(Ps 29.6; Hab 3.6) The mountains skipped like rams, the hills like lambs.
Why is it, O sea, that you flee? O Jordan, that you turn back?
O mountains, that you skip like rams? O hills, like lambs?
(Ps 96.9) Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the LORD, at the presence of the God of Jacob,
(Ex 17.6; Deut 8.15; Ps 107.35) who turns the rock into a pool of water, the flint into a spring of water.
